snippet: Chinese archaeologists have unearthed 110 new terra-cotta soldiers of the kind that stunned the world when thousands of such figures were first discovered in the 1970s at Xian in central China, part of a tomb army built to guard China's first emperor...
abstract: Chinese archaeologists have unearthed 110 new terra-cotta soldiers of the kind that stunned the world when thousands of such figures were first discovered in the 1970s at Xian in central China, part of a tomb army built to guard China's first emperor in the afterlife.

headline.main: New Trove of Terra-Cotta Warriors Unearthed in China
